title: Eddy Cue reveals the three reasons Apple won’t build a search engine
description: Apple and Google’s $20 billion deal, which sees Google serve as the default search engine on the iPhone, is under scrutiny. As we reported this morning, the United States DOJ is continuing its case against Google’s dominance in the search industry – and that lucrative Apple agreement is a focal point. In a new court filing this week spotted by Reuters, Eddy Cue, Apple’s Senior Vice President of Services, outlined why Apple itself would never develop its own search engine. more…

title: Ending Google search partnership would hamstring Apple, says Eddy Cue
description: In a declaration filed on Monday, Apple's senior vice president of services, Eddy Cue, asserted that Apple has no interest in creating its own search engine and would prefer to continue to use Google.In 2022, Google paid Apple $20 billion to be the default search engine on its devices. The result was a boon for both Google and Apple, with Apple receiving about 36% of the ad revenue generated from Safari search result advertising.The declaration, spotted by Reuters, is Apple's attempt at defending Google. Cue's stance is the same one that the company has defended for quite some time now.The declaration lists several reasons Apple is satisfied with its deal with Google. It also explains why the Cupertino tech giant has no interest in creating its own search engine. Continue Reading on AppleInsider | Discuss on our Forums

title: Best iPhone 16 cases for 16 & Plus, 16 Pro & Pro Max
description: Macworld The first thing you should do after buying a new iPhone 16, be it an iPhone 16 Plus, Pro or Max, is to admire it and then swiftly cover it up. Buy yourself an iPhone 16 case to protect your precious mobile after splashing a ton of cash on it, and add some style to make your new handset more personal. Cases come in more shapes and size and with more functionality than you’d believe. We have hand tested the best to find the perfect case for your iPhone 16, 16 Plus, 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max. Best clear iPhone 16 cases Best-looking iPhone 16 cases Best protective cases for iPhone 16 Best leather and leather-alternative iPhone 16 cases Best iPhone 16 cases with wallet Best iPhone 16 case with camera accessories Best iPhone 16 case with built-in keyboard Best iPhone 16 cases with lanyards Best phone slings iPhone 16 case: Protection The most common causes for accidental smartphone damage are: dropping your phone on the ground, it falling from a pocket or bag, or it being knocked off a table. The main results of such phone accidents are cracked and scratched screens, followed by chipped corners and sides. In fact, research shows that within 10 weeks of purchase, half of all new phone users will drop their handset. D’oh! PROMOTIONESR iPhone 16 Pro Max Case Powerful built-in magnets with 1,500 g of holding force enable faster, easier place-and-go wireless charging and a secure lock on any MagSafe accessory. Plus robust and durable zinc-alloy construction ensures stand stays looking like new while hinge is lab tested to retain its strength after more than 3,000 uses. buy now Even a basic phone case will offer some protection against such everyday drops and knocks, and some are built to withstand more catastrophic accidents. A few years ago, such ultra-protective cases meant you’d be carrying around something the size and weight of a brick, but modern materials mean that protective cases can be relatively slim and light. Clever design and tough-but-thin materials such as Kevlar and Graphene are key to the levels of robustness—but it remains the case that the bulkier the case, the more protection it will offer as long as it is also clever and made of the right stuff. Let’s face it the iPhone is basically made front and back of glass—even if it is a new version of Ceramic Shield that Apple claims is “two times tougher than any smartphone glass”—and glass dropped on the floor usually ends in despair. Look for raised edges (known as a bezel) around the screen that will protect it from drop cracks and scratches—it lands on these edges and not the fragile screen. Another point of obvious weakness is the camera lens area, and you should go for a case with a raised edge around that part, too, in case the phone lands that side down. Where we have the exact dimensions, we have included this information in our case reviews below. Look for button covers—in metal or plastic. Some cases prefer cutouts but may offer less protection as a result. The iPhone 16’s new Camera Control on the right side of all the iPhone 16 models may take third-party case makers time to catch up as most won’t have seen the latest iPhone before Apple announced it to the world. This “button” is capacitive so it can’t be covered using standard materials in the same way as the other iPhone buttons can. In its own cases, Apple (and Apple-owned Beats) utilizes a piece of sapphire crystal coupled with a conductive layer to communicate finger movements—including taps, slides and swipes—to the button below. That means it retains all its functionality, including the half-press and swipes. At launch, only the OtterBox Lumen iPhone 16 cases, reviewed below, feature the same Camera Control covering. But now the rest are catching up, with dbrand and Torras (both reviewed below) adding a capacitive button to the Canera Control. iPhone 16 case: Style Apple makes the iPhone a thing of sleek beauty and offers a small range of colors (exciting for the iPhone 16 and 16 Plus, but rather dull for the Pro and Pro Max). If you want to keep this Apple elegance while still protecting the phone, choose a clear case that won’t detract from the Apple designers’ art. If you want to add more personality—if only to distinguish your iPhone from those of your family, friends or colleagues—there are hundreds of designs to choose from. Some are quite beautiful, some fine art, and some I wouldn’t want to be seen with in a dark room. And iPhone 16 cases come in many forms: wallet cases, cases that support bike and car mounts, phone pouches, sleeves, slings and cases with belt-clips. Here we keep adding the best we can find as they come in for testing. iPhone 16 case: Fit Ensure you choose the right case for your exact model so that it fits correctly over the buttons and camera lenses for uninterrupted use. Where possible we have linked to the buying pages for each model: iPhone 16 (6.1 inch), iPhone 16 Plus (6.7 inch), iPhone 16 Pro (6.3 inch) and iPhone 16 Pro Max (6.9 inch). Don’t think you can squeeze your new 16 model iPhone into a case for an older model. Sometimes a new iPhone is the same size as the previous model, but not the 16 unfortunately. Upgraders need a new case. iPhone 16 case: magnetic wireless charging Also make sure that the case is MagSafe compatible so that you can charge wirelessly with a MagSafe charger while your iPhone 16 stays in its case. So-called “clear” cases sadly require a huge white ring on their back to be compatible with MagSafe charging. Colored, patterned or leather cases hide their magnets better. You can, of course, still charge via a USB-C cable—which will always be the fastest way to charge an iPhone—and an iPhone charger. Best clear iPhone cases for iPhone 16, 16 Plus, 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max If covering up Apple’s iPhone offends your inner Jony Ive, look for a clear, transparent case that keeps the iPhone’s looks as wonderful as they were straight out of the box. 1. Apple iPhone 16 Clear Case with MagSafe – Best clear iPhone 16 case Pros Made by Apple Shows off iPhone’s color Cons Basic protection Expensive Price When Reviewed: $49 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price $37 View Deal $37 View Deal $37.99 View Deal $39.99 View Deal $49 View Deal $49 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide View more prices Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $37 at Amazon$37 at Walmart Electronics$37.99 at Best Buy View more prices from Target AppleApple United States Close × Best Prices Today: Apple iPhone 16 Clear Case with MagSafe – Best clear iPhone 16 case Retailer Price $37 View Deal $37 View Deal $37.99 View Deal $39.99 View Deal $49 View Deal $49 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide View more prices Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket MagSafe compatible: Yes Weight: 29g Camera edge: 2mm Button covers: Plastic Action button: Covered Camera Control: Covered Colors: Clear Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max This simple, rigid iPhone 16 protective case from Apple is thin and light, and by design, it doesn’t disguise the color of your iPhone 16 that you chose when you purchased it. Why pick out a Pink or Desert Titanium iPhone 16 Pro Max, only to cover it up in a black plastic case or something with badly drawn flowers on it? With Apple’s Clear case, you get decent protection without ruining the look of the phone.(If you want a black case or flowery pattern instead of Apple’s small palette of colors, we have plenty for you to choose from lower down this feature. The Apple Clear Case is made from a blend of optically clear polycarbonate and other flexible materials, with a scratch-resistant coating on both the inside and outside. While it’s more protective than silicone cases and features a robust-looking 2mm camera lip, you can find tougher cases, which we have reviewed below. There is one part of the case that isn’t clear—the white MagSafe ring on the back. As with all the Apple cases, the Camera Control is covered with a capacitive button that allows for finger taps and gestures without compromising on protection. The bottom of the case is a large cutout, however, leaving the USB-C port, speakers and microphone exposed. At 29g it’s super light, and while the rigid case adds a little bulk, it’s worth a little compromise for that layer of protection. All materials and coatings are optimized to prevent yellowing over time. There are also cheaper clear cases, which we have also tested for you. But the Apple badge is a sure sign of quality, as you’d expect. The colors on the new iPhone 16 Pro and Pro Max models aren’t as exciting as the iPhone 16 and 16 Plus, though, so we wouldn’t blame you for deciding on something more joyful. 2. ESR Zero Clear Case for iPhone 16 – Best budget clear iPhone 16 case Pros Shows off iPhone’s color Flexible Affordable Cons Basic protection Price When Reviewed: $15.99 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price $6.79 View Deal ESR $15.99 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $6.79 at Amazon$15.99 at ESR MagSafe compatible: Yes Weight: 27g Raised edge: 1mm Camera edge: 0.7mm Button covers: Plastic Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Clear Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max If you want basic protection for your new iPhone 16, the clear ESR Zero Clear Case has a 1.2mm front edge to protect the screen and a smaller-than-most 0.7mm camera guard. It’s made from a crystal-clear polymer, which ESR claims resists yellowing for longer than cheaper cases. It is wireless compatible so you don’t need to flip the case off to charge wirelessly. ESR also makes other less flexible but tougher clear cases, such as the iPhone 16 Air Armor Clear Case with better drop protection and AirGuard corners. The iPhone 16 Pro Classic Hybrid Case has a tough scratch-resistant acrylic back and is available in a Shimmer effect that adds a little more excitement and personality to your average clear case. The iPhone 16 Classic Hybrid Case with Stash Stand, which features military-grade protection and a handy built-in kickstand for stable viewing, is reviewed below. These clear alternatives add a little more weight and cost but are recommended for their extra protection and features. 3. Totallee Super Thin Case for iPhone 16 – Slimmest, lightest hard clear iPhone 16 case Pros Slimmest clear case Lightest case Cons Basic protection MagSafe costs more Price When Reviewed: From $35 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price $35 View Deal Totallee $35 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $35 at Amazon$35 at Totallee MagSafe compatible: Optional Weight: 8g Button covers: Covered Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Clear, Frosted Clear, Frosted Black, Frosted Red, Frosted Green, Frosted Navy Blue Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max This is the slimmest (0.5mm) iPhone 16 case we have tested and—by a long way—the lightest at just 8g. Totallee claims the case weighs 0.2oz, which is 3g but our scales weighed it at 8g, which could just be a failing of our scales. In either case, even 8g is barely noticeable. Even at this weight, there are button covers, and a cutout for the Camera Control. There is a clear version and a similar Frosted Clear model, plus a bunch of other frosted colors to choose from. Note that you have to pay a little more for the MagSafe-compatible versions, which no doubt add a little weight and thickness in parts. 4. ESR iPhone 16 Classic Hybrid Case with Stash Stand – Best clear iPhone 16 case with stand Pros Shows off iPhone’s true color Built-in kickstand Cons Heavy Price When Reviewed: $22.99 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price $19.99 View Deal ESR $22.99 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $19.99 at Amazon$22.99 at ESR MagSafe compatible: Yes Weight: 41g Raised edge: 1.2mm Camera edge: 0.7mm Button covers: Plastic Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Clear, Clear/Black, Clear/Blue, Clear/Pink, Clear/Green, Clear/Gray Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max A more functional clear option is ESR’s Classic Hybrid Case with Stash Stand, available for all models of the iPhone 16 family. Make sure you choose your exact model. It is transparent, aside from the required giant MagSafe icon, and more affordable than the Apple clear case. The kickstand—otherwise hidden in the camera ring—is an added bonus, working in both landscape and portrait modes. The metal stand is an extra camera guard when not in use. ESR even suggests you can use it to carry your iPhone on your finger when your hands are full. If so, you’ll be interested in the protection it offers if it slides off your finger… There’s the usual tough talk of military-grade protection, with the case featuring shock-absorbing AirGuard corners and a 0.7mm camera lip. At 40g, it’s one of the heavier clear cases, which is caused by the handy metal kickstand. 5. Casetify clear Impact and Bounce Cases for iPhone 16 – Most customizable clear iPhone 16 case Pros Shows off iPhone’s true color Protection level options Built-in kickstand option Cons Not entirely transparent Price When Reviewed: From $72 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price Casetify $72 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $72 at Casetify MagSafe compatible: Yes Weight: 45g Raised edge: 1.4mm Camera edge: 2mm Button covers: Plastic Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Clear Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max One of our favorite clear options is Casetify’s Impact and Bounce cases, which are both available for all models of the iPhone 16 family. Casetify offers these cases in a selection of protection levels and handily shows you what each case will look like depending on the color of your iPhone. It is solidly built and feels robust, offering a minimum of 6.6ft (2m) drop protection up to 32.8ft (10m) if you choose the Ultra Bounce Case. For a little extra outlay, the Impact Case can be ordered with an integrated stand, otherwise hidden in the camera ring. The case edges aren’t clear because they feature extra-protective EcoShock or TesseLock designs. On one side there are sockets to easily attach phone charms. Casetify The Bounce Case boasts 21.3ft (6.5m) drop protection, while the Ultra Bounce promises an incredible 23.8ft (10m). The more protection, sadly the less of the original phone can be seen even in a clear case, but most of the shock absorption on the Bounce case family protrudes from the corners. 6. Rokform Crystal Case iPhone 16 – Most protective clear iPhone 16 case Pros Shows off iPhone’s color (mostly) Robust protection Cons Not entirely transparent Not MagSafe compatible Heavy Price When Reviewed: $69.99 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price $69.99 View Deal Rokform £69.99 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $69.99 at Amazon£69.99 at Rokform MagSafe compatible: No Weight: 75g Raised edge: 2mm Camera edge: 1mm Button covers: Plastic Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Clear with black trim Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max For those who want to see and show off their iPhone’s original coloring, but still gain maximum protection, Rokform offers its Crystal Case for the iPhone 16 family. This is more solid looking than even the Casetify Ultra Bounce reviewed above. As you’d expect, that protection comes at the price of some bulk and heft. It’s not fully clear because its black sides, edges and corners are made from a military-grade polycarbonate and TPU combination to absorb shocks from drops and falls. At present, the Rokform cases are too thick to work with all MagSafe chargers so you will likely need to remove your phone from the case to charge it wirelessly. The company is planning a thinner version, and we’d recommend waiting for that MagSafe-compatible version if you want accessible wireless charging. The case also features the Rokform’s famous twist-lock and magnetic mounting system for bike, motorcycle and car mounts. If you’re going biking with iPhone on your handlebars, a super-protective case is a must. Rokform does ship internationally, but you’ll need to check the fees depending on your region, and remember that customs charges also vary by country. 7. Incase Slim Case for MagSafe for iPhone 16 Pros Shows off iPhone’s true color Dedicated lanyard loop Price When Reviewed: $39.99 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price $27.99 View Deal $27.99 View Deal $39.95 View Deal Incase $39.99 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $27.99 at Best Buy$27.99 at Target $39.95 at Amazon View more prices from Incase Close × Best Prices Today: Incase Slim Case for MagSafe for iPhone 16 Retailer Price $27.99 View Deal $27.99 View Deal $39.95 View Deal Incase $39.99 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket MagSafe compatible: Yes Button covers: Plastic Action button: Cutout Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Clear, Clear/Black, Clear/Deep Space Blue, Clear/Blush Pink, Clear/Highland Green Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max This hardshell iPhone 16 case is similar to the Apple Clear Case, although with a cutout for the Camera Control rather than leaving it covered. While it looks almost invisible—except for the necessary white MagSafe area— this case, made from recycled polycarbonate and TPU, still offers 8-foot drop protection with corner air pockets. The sides and buttons feature a frosted texture for enhanced grip. Also included is a handy dedicated lanyard loop. The straight clear Incase Slim Case for MagSafe is joined by shaded models in four subtle color ways. Best-looking iPhone cases for iPhone 16, 16 Plus, 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max While some will prefer a clear case to keep their iPhone’s natural color, others are easily bored and want a splash of difference, from plain new colors, through pretty or cool patterns, to fully customizable designs. We’ve counted hundreds of designs on offer, so there must be something here for you and your iPhone 16. 1. Apple iPhone 16 Silicone Case with MagSafe – Popular, Apple-branded colorful case range Pros Made by Apple Wide vibrant color range Cons Not as protective as others Expensive Price When Reviewed: $49 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price $22 View Deal $34 View Deal $34.99 View Deal $39.99 View Deal $49 View Deal $49 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide View more prices Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $22 at Amazon$34 at Walmart Electronics$34.99 at Best Buy View more prices from Target AppleApple United States Close × Best Prices Today: Apple iPhone 16 Silicone Case with MagSafe – Popular, Apple-branded colorful case range Retailer Price $22 View Deal $34 View Deal $34.99 View Deal $39.99 View Deal $49 View Deal $49 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide View more prices Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket MagSafe compatible: Yes Weight: 30g Button covers: Silicone Action button: Covered Camera Control: Covered Colors: Star Fruit, Ultramarine, Lake Green, Fuchsia, Stone Gray, Plum, Black, Denim Apple: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max Amazon: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max The smooth Apple Silicone case is a classic, popular protective iPhone covering—available in the widest range of colors with eight to choose from. There’s enough choice here to satisfy most people, but if you prefer to see the color of the iPhone itself, look to a clear case; see above. Apple pretty much threw out all its lovely Silicone colors from the iPhone 15 (Guava, Orange Sorbet, Winter Blue, Black, Storm Blue, Clay. Light Pink, Cypress, Sunshine, Pink, Soft Mint, Light Blue) and dreamt up a whole new bunch, many of which are poppy and vibrant. It is as protective as you need for everyday calamities except big falls—if you want ultra protection, look to our best protective cases reviewed further down. If you are prone to letting your phone slip out of your hand, look for cases made from TPU, Kevlar or Graphene. It is made with a soft-touch, almost silky 55% recycled silicone material. Inside, the lining is soft microfiber to protect the iPhone itself from scratches. Apple has added a silicone button to the Action button but left the new Camera Control button covered up with a conductive layer to communicate finger movements to the control—at the time of writing, only the OtterBox iPhone 16 case has anything similar with most other cases using a simple cutout for the Camera Control. Apple has somehow engineered a little screen animation when you place the iPhone inside the Silicone Case, which is a nice—if otherwise not very useful—touch. Aside from the colors and the attention to detail, people flock to this Apple case apart because it’s made by Apple and has the famous logo on the back. You can’t go wrong buying an Apple-made case, but you can find more options elsewhere. 2. Casetify iPhone 16 Case – Best custom iPhone 16 cases Pros Many customization options Protection levels Cons Expensive Price When Reviewed: From $62 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price $35.69 View Deal Casetify $62 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $35.69 at Amazon$62 at Casetify MagSafe compatible: Yes (where stated) Weight: 69g (Ultra Case) Raised edge: 1.4 to 1.6mm Camera edge: 2 to 3.8mm Button covers: Plastic Action button: Cutout Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Multiple customization options Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max Amazon: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max While the iPhone 16 and 16 Plus colors have some panache, the 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max iPhones are a bit metal bachelor pad in our opinion. To add some fun you need a non-clear case, and if you want to impose your own personality then look for customization options. The most customizable range of iPhone 16 cases we’ve seen are from Casetify, where you can mix and match colors, patterns, prints, artists, and personalization options, as well as several levels of protection. Prices vary and rise depending on the protection levels, but for most you get a wide range of design options. The level of choice is almost overwhelming, and you’ll have fun choosing the case that looks just right for you. A new Harry Potter range of iPhone 16 cases and accessories has recently been added. You can add a name or short word, plus add hearts and stars, fonts, and text colors if you desire. Some cases feature a pull-out stand, which is otherwise hidden in the camera ring. Casetify also offers a range of protection levels: Impact (8.2ft drop protection, 4x MIL-STD-810G or 6.6ft and 3x with a ring stand), Bounce (21.3ft drop protection, 6x MIL-STD-810G), Ultra Bounce (Bounce corners, 32.8 ft. drop protection, 10x MIL-STD-810G) and, for the 16 Pro and Pro Max, Ultra (Ultra Bounce corners, 32.8 ft. drop protection, 10x MIL-STD-810G, 6-layered rugged protection). The raised bezel to protect the screen can be either 1.4mm or 1.6mm, and the protective camera ring from 2mm to 3.8mm. The Impact Ring case features the tallest camera-protecting lip at 3.6mm, the biggest we’ve seen in our tests. You’ll find all the customization options direct from Casetify—see the links above. 3. Casely iPhone 16 Classic and Bold Cases – Best iPhone 16 case for colorful protection Pros Optional protection levels Design options Cons Low camera edge Price When Reviewed: From $25 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price Casely $25 View Deal $39.95 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $25 at Casely$39.95 at Amazon MagSafe compatible: Yes Weight: 34g (Bold Case) Raised edge: 3mm (Bold), 1.3mm (Classic) Camera edge: 1.33mm (Bold), 0.75mm (Classic) Button covers: Plastic Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Over 60 designs available Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max Amazon: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max While not as customizable as the Casetify iPhone 16 cases, the range of Casely design options is almost overwhelming, including designs based on works by Impressionists Van Gogh and Monet. You could well end up buying more than one! Aside from the 95+ designs, you can choose between the Classic and Bold case models for each type of iPhone 16. The Classic Collection is lighter and more flexible with a glossy finish, while the Bold Collection is more protective and comes with a matte finish. The Bold models have ribbed sides, which adds real grip, making it less likely that you’ll drop your iPhone in the first place—but if you do there’s impressive 8-foot drop protection and a 3mm raised screen lip (only 1.3mm on the Classic), the highest we’ve tested. Best leather iPhone cases for iPhone 16, 16 Plus, 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max Apple made a deliberate move away from leather with its accessories at the launch of the iPhone 15 and has stuck to its vegan ways with the iPhone 16. Apple’s alternative was a micro twill called FineWoven—however, customers were quick to complain that it easily picked up stains from just about anything it come into contact with, and the company has rightly abandoned it for its new iPhone. If you want a leather alternative we recommend the vegan leather MOFT MOVAS case, reviewed below. But if you are happier with the real animal skin thing, there are some great leather cases to choose from, as you’ll find by reading on. 1. Mujjo Full Leather Wallet Case for iPhone 16 – Best leather iPhone 16 case with wallet card holder Pros Stylish Wallet option Cons Cards prevent wireless charging Price When Reviewed: From $59 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price Mujjo $59 View Deal $64 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $59 at Mujjo$64 at Amazon MagSafe compatible: Yes (without cards) Weight: 35g (Full Leather Wallet Case) Raised edge: 1mm Button covers: Metal Action button: Covered (Pro & Max) Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Black, Dark Tan, Monaco Blue, Steel Blue, Livid Green, Green Smoke Available for: All iPhone 16 models Dutch designer Mujjo has been making some of our favorite leather Apple accessories for many years. It has four different cases available for the iPhone 16, three of them are crafted from premium leather and a new Eager to win some green points, the company points out that sustainable “DriTan water-free leather tanning” is involved—this uses the moisture already present in the hides. The buttons, camera bump, microfiber lining, and polycarbonate inner shell are made from recycled plastic. All the cases feature machined-metal buttons, 1mm raised bezel and a metal rear camera bump for superior protection. If you want a leather iPhone case with some extra benefits, the Mujjo Full Leather Wallet Case (for iPhone 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max) turns your iPhone into a physical as well as digital wallet. The leather card pocket can hold two or three bank, ID or travel cards. Note that the cards must be removed for wireless charging—even with cards removed, the magnetic connection is not as strong as with the cases that don’t include a wallet at the back, although it does still work with MagSafe chargers. To be fair, the same is true for all wallet-cases we tested. Available in Dark Tan, Black, or Monaco Blue. The Mujjo Full Leather Case (all models except the 16 Plus) is a more classic leather case without the wallet at the back, with a machined-metal rear camera bump that protects lenses. It’s available in a range of colors depending on the iPhone model. If you agree with Apple that leather is not for you, the Mujjo Maizcase is made with an Italian bio-leather, created with a blend of corn and other cereals and recycled polyester. It’s available in Steel Blue only. The Mujjo iPhone 16 Pro Shield Case (for iPhone 16 Pro and 16 Pro Max) is designed to be super protective, as the name suggests, and is available for the two Pro models of the 16. Mujjo claims that drop protection is rated to 15 feet (5m), and it features an “ImpactCore internal bumper”. Take your choice of colors from Black or Steel Blue. 2. Woolnut Leather Case for iPhone 16 Pros Stylish Metal buttons Price When Reviewed: $59 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price Woolnut $59 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $59 at Woolnut MagSafe compatible: Yes Weight: 35g Raised edge: 1.3mm Camera edge: 1mm Button covers: Metal Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Black, Cognac, Green, Gray Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max We’ve long been fans of the simple, minimalist but luxury accessories from Swedish firm Woolnut. You’ll find them in our roundups of the best laptop sleeves and in previous collections of the best iPhone cases. Woolnut hasn’t moved far with its Leather Case for iPhone 16, which looks much like the same for all the other iPhones since the 12. And why stray from a classic case? The full-grain leather cover the slim polycarbonate and TPU frame is from Scandinavia, of course, and the interior features soft microfiber. The buttons are made from aluminum, not plastic as used on most cases. The tapered cutout for Camera Control feels sensuous on the finger. Altogether a lovely, understated case. 3. Grams(28) MagSafe Leather Cases Pros Stylish Debossed initials option Price When Reviewed: From $62 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price GRAMS28 $62 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $62 at GRAMS28 MagSafe compatible: Yes Weight: 32g (16 Pro) Raised edge: 1mm Camera edge: 1mm Button covers: Leather Action button: Covered (Pro & Max) Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Black, blue, green, burgundy and brown Available for: iPhone 16 Pro and iPhone 16 Pro Max Grams(28) is a high-end luxury brand specializing in aesthetic but functional accessories made from high-quality leather sourced from Italy. It has three models of case for the iPhone 16 Pro and iPhone 16 Pro Max only. Non-Pro iPhone owners look elsewhere. The Pebbled Leather Case has that classic textured leather grain pattern, made from Italian Pebbled Bovine Leather in Black, Navy and Dark Green. The Snowflake Leather Case is made from Italian Vegetable Tanned Snowflake Leather—also known as pueblo leather—with a glossier rugged surface coming through after 90 days usage. It’s available in Black, Jeans and Tabacco colors. The limited-edition Horween Leather Case is made from the iconic Horween Leather Company Chromexcel leather in Burgundy and Brown. Each of these iPhone 16 cases are MagSafe compatible and feature a robust 360-degree TPE bumper and 1mm raised ridge above the screen and camera lenses—with 5-foot drop protection. Uniquely, the company can personalize the case with a hand-debossing service that stamps your initials deeply into the leather’s surface. 4. MOFT Snap Phone Case MOVAS – Best vegan leather iPhone 16 case Pros Smooth texture Vegan leather Lanyard option Price When Reviewed: $49.99 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price $49.99 View Deal MOFT $49.99 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $49.99 at Amazon$49.99 at MOFT MagSafe compatible: Yes Weight: 34g Raised edge: 1.3mm Camera edge: 1mm Button covers: Metal Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Jet Black, Taupe, Misty Cove, Cement, Earthen Beige Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max If you desire something from a more monochromatic palette, the minimalist MOFT Snap Case MOVAS for iPhone 16 offers a range of cool, muted color options. The Snap Case is made from MOFT’s own MOVAS-P, a four-layer soft-touch vegan leather that the company claims is non-fading and fingerprint, scratch and stain resistant. The side buttons are metal for better responsiveness and durability. The Camera Control is a cutout like on most of the non-Apple cases. The raised front edge is 1.3mm, offering excellent screen protection, and the camera cutout is elevated by 1mm. There is a special version that is compatible with a Phone Lanyard for hands-free use, priced separately at $29.99. Best iPhone 16 cases with wallet There are several great choices for iPhone 16 cases that feature built-in wallets. Scan the reviews above for some examples, such as: Mujjo Full Leather Wallet Case – beautiful design and stylish wallet Smartish Wallet Slayer Vol. 2 – Practical three-card wallet Some include wallets that attach to the case magnetically and other have the wallet built in. Note that built-in wallets usually affect wireless charging, especially with cards inside. You’d need to remove the Smartish Wallet Slayer case to use wireless charging, for example. 1. Vena vCommute iPhone 16 Wallet Case Pros Stores 3 cards Solid build Responsive buttons Cons Standard version is not MagSafe compatible Price When Reviewed: $49.99 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price $31.88 View Deal Vena $49.99 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $31.88 at Amazon$49.99 at Vena MagSafe compatible: No Weight: 71g (16 Pro) Raised edge: 1.6mm Camera edge: 1.6mm Button covers: Plastic Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Gray-Black, Blue-Silver, Rose Gold-Red, Pastel Pink, Pastel Blue, Deep Purple Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max This is a solidly built but stylish wallet case for iPhone, which comes in two versions and multiple colors. In the standard Vena vCommute up to three cards can be stored inside the case, covered with a classy leather folding door that can also be used as a landscape kickstand. Cards feel more secure here than sticking out of the back of the case or stored in a separate accessory that magnetically clamps to the back of the phone. The downside is that the standard version is not MagSafe compatible for wireless charging, even with the cards removed. Hence the vCommute with a removable MagSafe-compatible wallet. Detach the wallet part and you can wirelessly charge the phone within the case. Just don’t forget to re-attach the wallet when you get up to leave your wireless charger! 2. Decoded iPhone 16 Leather Detachable Wallet Case – Best wraparound wallet case Pros 360 protective cover Physical wallet Cons Still MagSafe compatible even with cards Price When Reviewed: $80 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price Decoded $80 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $80 at Decoded MagSafe compatible: Yes Weight: 119g (16 Pro) Button covers: Metal Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Tan Brown, Navy Blue, Clay Beige, Black Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max Most wallet iPhone cases place the card slots at the back, which can hamper wireless MagSafe charging. The Decoded Leather Detachable Wallet Case is more flexible. It’s actually two cases in one as the standard case magnetically clamps onto a full-grain Ecco leather fold-out wraparound that features the wallet card slots behind the front panel. The detachable wallet includes three card slots, plus storage for banknotes. This front part offers double protection for the screen aside from the raised edge found on the case. There’s further magnetic magic on the folding closure. The case promises 1.2m drop protection, and the button covers are metal for further robustness and precise control. The whole package is surprisingly slim for a full wraparound wallet. You could place the bare phone straight onto the wraparound cover, but you’d lose the 360-degree protection should the phone be dropped. Decoded also offers a more traditional one-piece Leather Case, without the wallet wraparound part. 3. Ninja Labs Flex Pouch – Most stretchable wallet case Pros Stretchable mega wallet Cons Not MagSafe compatible Price When Reviewed: $78 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price Ninja Labs $78 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $78 at Ninja Labs MagSafe compatible: No Weight: 90g (16 Pro) Button covers: Plastic Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Matcha, Lavender, Black Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max The unique Flex Pouch from Ninja Labs is for people who want to store more than three credit cards in their iPhone case wallet. Super stretchable, the silicone pouch can firmly hold as many objects as some of us have in our backpack pockets! It can keep a robust grip on your ID cards, cash, AirPods, pens, lighter and lipstick and not blink or tear—it is not recommended to store your keys or any other sharp objects in the pouch. Stuffed full the Flex Pouch might just about fit in a coat pocket. Even if you just want to store a few cards, we found the Flex Pouch a tight hold. It is slightly wider at the top and tighter on the bottom. Once emptied, it pings back to its original flat form. With an AirPods case inside, you can use the case as a landscape stand. The case itself feels robust and is available in three colors. Each of these can then have either an opaque or similarly colored pouch on the back. Shipping is free $50 within the U.S. and worldwide shipping costs are calculated per country. 4. Bellroy Phone Case, 3 Card – Leather wallets built-in and magnetic Pros Wallet options Clever kickstand Cons MagSafe requires phone or wallet removal Price When Reviewed: $79 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price $44.25 View Deal $79 View Deal Bellroy $79 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $44.25 at Best Buy$79 at Amazon$79 at Bellroy MagSafe compatible: No Weight: 76g (16 Pro, Mod version) Button covers: Plastic Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Black, Sienna, Agave, Terracotta, Cobalt, Everglade, Ganache Available for: All iPhone 16 models Australian company Bellroy is perhaps more famous for its wallets than its phone cases, so it’s appropriate that we feature it here for its iPhone 16 cases that feature wallets, either built-in or attached magnetically. There are two leather wallet case options. The Bellroy Phone Case – 3 Cards has an integrated wallet that cleverly unfolds to create a landscape kickstand. The Bellroy Mod Phone Case + Wallet (16 Pro and 16 Pro Max only) can also hold three cards and can create a kickstand, but it is a separate piece that magnetically clamps to the back of the leather case. This means that you can easily detach it if you want to magnetically wireless charge your iPhone without removing it from the case, as you have to do with the Phone Case with built-in wallet. The two brown versions (dark ganache and tan Sienna) feature natty bold colors on the inside. There are various color options depending on your iPhone 16 model and wallet case choice. If you want to add just a separate magnetic wallet to your phone without the case, or with a different case, consider the Mujjo Full leather Magnetic Wallet for iPhone. Best iPhone case with camera accessories The iPhone 16 has a wonderful array of cameras but photography enthusiasts and professionals will hanker after fancier lenses and better grips. You can still make calls and use your favorite apps, but your phone photos will look even more sensational if you get the right gear for your phone. 1. ShiftCam Lens Cases – Best iPhone 16 case with camera lens mount Pros Fit pro lenses and grips Wide photography ecosystem Price When Reviewed: From $39.99 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price ShiftCam $39.99 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $39.99 at ShiftCam MagSafe compatible: Yes Weight: 47g (16 Pro, Fabric version) Button covers: Metal Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Clear, Fabric Stone, Fabric Midnight Available for: All iPhone 16 models Enhance your mobile photography to new heights using ShiftCam’s lens cases that connect with the S.Mount twist and lock system that is a secure and fast attachment for your choice of lenses. Available in two styles, Clear and Fabric, the case is compatible with Apple’s MagSafe technology the iPhone 16’s new Camera Control button. It features 2m drop protection and for outdoors users can be cleaned in a dishwasher. Each is lightweight and stylish. You can select from a choice of individual LensUltra lenses, including 60mm Telephoto, 16mm Wide Angle, 10x Traditional Macro and 200° Fisheyes; and for filmmakers 75mm Long Range Macro, 1.33x Anamorphic and 1.55x Anamorphic. Prices start at $129.99 / £129.99. These are easy to mount on the special iPhone case, feel reassuringly heavy and have earned excellent reviews from better photographers than me. The ShiftCam ecosystem also includes a range of ergonomic magnetic snap-on mobile battery grips (SnapStudio Light and SnapGrip Pro, from $89.99), inspired by pro digital cameras, that offer greater stability and a shutter button. turning every phone into a pro camera. The grip also includes a built-in 5000mAh battery power bank capable of delivering 20W charging. Apple sells an exclusive ShiftCam ProGrip Starter Kit for $149.95 / £129.95. Best iPhone case with built-in keyboard One of the joys of a smartphone is its lack of physical keyboard, which is why BlackBerry no longer makes phones. But … but… there are some benefits of ditching the virtual keyboard and freeing up valuable screen space after all. 1. Clicks case for iPhone 16 – Add a BlackBerry-like keyboard Pros Adds a physical 36-key keyboard Access to iOS Shortcuts Frees up screen space Strong colors Cons Adds length to the phone Price When Reviewed: From $139 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price Clicks $139 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $139 at Clicks MagSafe compatible: Yes Weight: 70g (Pro); 80g (Pro Max) Button covers: Plastic Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Surf (blue), Onyx (black), Spice (ochre) Available for: iPhone 16 all models It seems an abomination to make the iPhone act and even look like a BlackBerry but there are people out there who want to have a physical keyboard attached to their iPhone. Actually, it’s not as mad as it sounds. Not using the screen keyboard can give you back nearly half your usable screen, and it allows navigation within and between apps with fewer swipes and taps by turning each of its 37 keys into customizable action buttons for over 100 shortcuts, leveraging iOS’s native Shortcuts app and accessibility settings that are otherwise inaccessible to iPhone users. Using the Clicks Keyboard app users can personalize their keyboard experience with features such as brightness levels, dim timeouts, battery optimization options, alt lock, and caps lock. You can even create an Android-like Back button. Additionally, the shortcuts can unlock advanced automations such as calling Uber, emailing meeting updates, and controlling smart home devices. The Clicks version for iPhone 16 lacks some of the iPhone 15 Clicks crazy colors, but the new ochre color is still quite out there. The new iPhone 16 version features a refined keyboard with new contoured ergonomically designed keys that offer an elevated typing experience with a lighter touch, plus brushed metal side keys, a microfiber lining and a new enclosure. Clicks has spaced out the keys, which are 9% larger than on previous versions and you can really tell the difference. The latest version now works with Apple’s MagSafe magnetic wireless charging, which was absent on the previous version. Clicks for iPhone 16 Pro and iPhone 16 Pro Max will be available to order beginning October. Clicks for iPhone 16 and iPhone 16 Plus models will be available in Dcember. The Clicks for iPhone 16 Pro Case is 19.1cm long (compared to the phone’s 14.7cm length) and weighs 70g; for iPhone Pro Max, 20.7cm (16cm iPhone) and 80g. The case is now made from tougher TPU rather than silicone. Best iPhone cases with lanyards and wrist straps Why stuff your iPhone into your trouser or coat pocket or deep into your handbag when you could wear it round your neck or across your shoulder for easier access? Several of the iPhone 16 cases we tested have lanyard options, which we mention in the reviews above or pick out here for particular attention. 1. Mageasy Odyssey Ultra and Roam for iPhone 16 Pro and Pro Max Pros Removable lanyard options External pouch option Robust Price When Reviewed: $79.99 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price $79.99 View Deal Mageasy $79.99 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $79.99 at Amazon$79.99 at Mageasy MagSafe compatible: Yes Weight: 109g (16 Pro), 291g with lanyard Raised edge: 1.5mm (Odyssey Ultra), 1.3mm (Roam) Camera edge: 1.4mm (Odyssey Ultra), 1.1mm (Roam) Button covers: Plastic Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Titanium (Odyssey); Titanium, Black, Rose, Clear (Roam); Black, Starlight White, Rose, Gray, Camel Brown (Pouch) Available for (Odyssey): iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max Available for (Roam): iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max Available for (Pouch): iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max Mageasy has a range of cases for the iPhone 16 family that feature detachable lanyards and even a wallet pouch that sits outside the case. Wearing your phone hanging from a lanyard can free up your hands while keeping the phone close for easy access. The chunkiest lanyard option comes with the most protective case, the $79 Odyssey Ultra Case—clearly the choice of Odysseus on his adventures. The case features interchangeable corners so you can replace the lanyard hooks with reinforced shockproof corners if you need protection rather than a neck-based strap. The 25mm Fidlock Utility Strap is not dainty in the least. This case has a central. ring stand that can rotate 360 degrees for precise adjustments in wither landscape and portrait orientation. It is U.S. military drop-test certified, providing protection from drops as high as 25 feet. The $35 Roam M + Strap Shockproof Protective Case with Lanyard boasts 16-foot drop protection and a less chunky design than the Odyssey. It offers a more elegant lanyard with integrated hooks. Looking quite unique, the $55 Pouch M Wallet Phone Case is a sleek 2-in-1 design that features a detachable wallet/purse with space for cards and folding cash. Coming with an adjustable leather strap, it can be worn over the shoulder or as a cross-body. Its zinc alloy clasp is well placed so that it doesn’t obstruct the camera lenses. Mageasy also offers a robust $39 MagStand 360 M with Rotating Ring Holder Protective Case, which doesn’t boast the lanyard option but is a solid and well-built clear iPhone 16 case with the same 360-degree ring stand as the Odyssey Ultra but with a lesser (but still impressive) 16-foot drop protection. 2. Bellroy Venture Phone 16 Pro Case Pros Removable wrist strap Sculpted body Price When Reviewed: $49 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price $49 View Deal Bellroy $49 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $49 at Amazon$49 at Bellroy MagSafe compatible: Yes Weight: 52g (16 Pro), 55g with lanyard Raised edge: 1mm Camera edge: 0.5mm Button covers: Metal Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Chalk, Shadow Available for: iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max What we love about the Bellroy Venture is is solid yet sculpted body, which gives it a look like no other. The lining inside the Chalk model is a striking orange, which is a detail you won’t often see but is a nice touch. It ships with its own wrist strap, with an aluminum attachment. All the buttons are metal, and the Side Button—above the Camera Control—is wonderfully textured to make it easy to locate. It features hidden side bumpers and internal padding, and looks and feels robust without seeming heavy. 3. BodyGuardz Paradigm Pro case for iPhone 16 Pro – with removable wrist strap for iPhone 16 Pros Removable wrist strap Heat vents Price When Reviewed: $54.95 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price $49.95 View Deal Bodyguardz $54.95 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $49.95 at Amazon$54.95 at Bodyguardz MagSafe compatible: Yes Weight: 59g (16 Pro) with wrist strap Button covers: Plastic Action button: Covered Camera Control: Cutout Colors: Black, Blue, Green, Purple, Leopard, Clear Available for: iPhone 16 | iPhone 16 Plus | iPhone 16 Pro | iPhone 16 Pro Max Keeping your iPhone out of your tight pocket or bag could have the added benefit of keeping it cool—unless you are in a very hot environment—with a a healthier battery as a result. The BodyGuardz Paradigm Pro case, available for iPhone 16 Pro and Pro Max, makes heat dissipation one of its core strengths with both a wrist strap and air vents along both sides. The company names this system of vents “EnduraCore technology”, and it’s a clever move to both improve the iPhone’s temperature and distinguish it from other cases. For non-Pro owners, there’s the BodyGuardz Ace Pro, which also comes with a detachable wrist strap but not the air vents. You do get a Black Leopard spot pattern, though. Both cases promise 18-foot drop protection and shock-absorbing corners. The wrist strap might deter pickpockets and other phone thieves, preventing speedy snatches out of your grasp. Best bags and slings for iPhone 16 If you don’t want to have your iPhone sticking out of your back pocket for all the world to see and seize, or jammed into a tight front pocket, consider a small bag or sling to keep your new iPhone protected and held away from your person. 1. WaterField Shinjuku Sling Pros Stylish sling Tech organizer Price When Reviewed: $129 Best Prices Today: Retailer Price WaterField Designs $129 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket $129 at WaterField Designs Size: 8 x 2.5 x 5 inches (20.3 x 6.4 x 12.7cm Weight: 320g (Waxed), 150g (Canvas) Colors: Waxed Canvas: Navy or Brown; Canvas Storm Gray, Black or Olive Green Available for: All iPhone models WaterField Designs makes great bags and its mini crossbody Shinjuku Sling is aimed at owners of the iPhone 16. A sling keeps your iPhone and other essentials close at hand and handsfree but not ruining the cut of your clothes. You don’t always need a full backpack, and a small sling like this may be all you need on a day out or commute. There’s just one size that will fit either any model of iPhone. There are two materials to choose from: a heavy-duty 15oz Waxed Canvas with a naturally rugged, distressed look, or lightweight waterproof X-Pac Canvas, in various colors. At the front a zippered pocket can store frequently needed items like a travel card or reading glasses. Inside, with a light diamond-patterned lining, there’s a side pocket that is foam-padded to cradle the iPhone, and two stretch pockets for your AirPods or whatever small items you don’t want to keep in your pockets. There’s even space in the central compartment for a slim 16oz water bottle, as well as keys. At the back you’ll find (but thieves won’t see) a zippered pocket that’s perfect for cash or a passport. The strap features a quick-release buckle that lets attach it to a chair or other furniture to protect it from thieves when you’re seated. How we tested iPhone 16 cases We tested the reviewed cases above using an iPhone 16 Pro. We tested for fit, look and feel, build quality, and magnetic wireless charging. We did not test the claims for Military Grade Protection by throwing the encased phone from speeding trains or hot air balloons or throwing it to the pavement. We have to trust the manufacturer’s claims on this but we did examine the raised screen and camera edges for robustness.

title: Mophie Powerstation Mini 5K Gold review: Stylish power bank
description: Macworld At a glanceExpert's Rating Pros Compact dimensions High quality Good charging times Cons No golden cable included No carrying case Our Verdict Small, practical, powerful–with the optional golden charging cable, it’s a great gift for a loved one. A power bank perfect for carrying in a handbag. Price When Reviewed This value will show the geolocated pricing text for product undefined Best Pricing Today Price When Reviewed$39.95 Best Prices Today: powerstation mini 5K Gold Limited Edition Retailer Price Mophie $40 View Deal Price comparison from over 24,000 stores worldwide Product Price Price comparison from Backmarket The small Powerstation Mini 5K Gold Limited Edition immediately catches the eye with its golden color. The housing is made of aluminium and has a bead-blasted finish. This gives it a high-quality look. With its compact dimensions of 7.6 by 4 by 2.5 centimeters, the Powerstation Mini 5K fits into any small bag. The capacity is 5,000 mAh and a four-stage LED display shows the charging status and remaining battery life. The USB-C port is capable of Power Delivery with a maximum output power of 20 watts. The output of 20 watts is sufficient for a charging capacity of 51 percentage points for the iPhone 15 and 24 percentage points for the 11-inch iPad Pro, both after 30 minutes. The output power of 20 watts is ideal for the iPhone, but can also power a camera or an iPad if required. The only thing missing is a protective bag to protect the stylish powerbank from scratches in your handbag. Should you buy the Powerstation Mini 5K Gold Limited Edition? The Powerstation Mini 5K scores points in several respects: the elegant housing is a real eye-catcher and the power bank is barely bigger than a lipstick. With 5,000 mAh, it offers enough capacity to recharge an iPhone after a long day. We have more power banks in our roundup of the best MagSafe and magnetic power banks for iPhone.

title: Ten years of Overcast: A new foundation
description: Today, on the tenth anniversary of Overcast 1.0, I’m happy to launch a complete rewrite and redesign of most of the iOS app, built to carry Overcast into the next decade — and hopefully beyond. Like podcasts better than blog posts? Listen to ATP #596 for more! What’s new Much faster, more responsive, more reliable, and more accessible. Modern design, optimized for easily-reached controls on today’s phone sizes. Improvements throughout, such as undoing large seeks, new playlist-priority options, easier navigation, and more. What’s not Most features. Overcast is still Overcast! The audio engine. It’s the best part of Overcast, and still leads the industry in sound quality, silence skipping, and volume normalization. (More soon!) The business. I’m still a one-person operation, with no funding or external ownership, serving only my customers. My principles. I always want to make the best podcast app, and I’ll never disrespect your time, attention, or privacy. What’s gone Streaming. Most big podcasts now use dynamic ad insertion, which causes bugs and problems for streaming playback.1 Downloading episodes completely before they begin playback is much more reliable. Tapping a non-downloaded episode will now open the playback screen, download it, then start playback. It works similarly to the way streaming did before, but playback begins after the download completes, not after a portion of it is buffered. On today’s fast networks, this usually only takes a few extra seconds. And in the near future, I’ll be adding smarter options and more control over selective downloading of episodes to further improve the experience for people who don’t automatically download every episode. What’s next The last few missing features from the old app, such as Shortcuts support, storage management, and OPML. These are absent now, but will return soon. More options for downloading and deleting episodes. Upgrading the Apple Watch app to the new, faster sync engine. (The Watch app is currently unchanged from the previous one.) And, of course, more features, including some of your most-requested features over the last decade. Getting this rewrite out the door was a monumental task. Thank you for your patience as I work through this list! Why? Most of Overcast’s core code was 10 years old, which made it cumbersome or impossible to easily move with the times, adopt new iOS functionality, or add new features, especially as one person. That’s why there haven’t been many new features or changes in years. You saw it, and I saw it. I wasn’t able to serve my customers as well as I wanted. For Overcast to have a future, it needed a modern foundation for its second decade. I’ve spent the past 18 months rebuilding most of the app with Swift, SwiftUI, Blackbird, and modern Swift concurrency. Now, development is rapidly accelerating. I’m more responsive, iterating more quickly, and ultimately making the app much better. Thank you all so much for the first decade of Overcast. Here’s to the next one. Dynamic ad insertion (DAI) splices ads into each download, and no two downloads are guaranteed to have the same number or duration of ads. So, for example, if the first half of an episode downloads, then the download fails, and it downloads the second half with another request, the combined audio may jump forward or back at the halfway mark, losing or repeating content. ↩︎

title: The Overcast Redesign: Part One
description: Overcast’s latest update (2022.2) brings the largest redesign in its nearly-eight-year history, plus many of the most frequently requested features and lots of under-the-hood improvements. I’m pretty proud of this one. For this first and largest phase of the redesign, I focused on the home screen, playlist screen, typography, and spacing. (I plan to revamp the now-playing and individual-podcast screens in a later update.) The home screen is radically different: Home screen, before (left) and after (right). Playlists now have strong visual identities for nicer and easier navigation. Each playlist has a customizable color, and a custom icon can be selected from over 3,000 SF Symbols to match modern iOS design and the other icons within Overcast. And playlists can be manually reordered with drag-and-drop. Recently played and newly published episodes can now be displayed on the home screen for quick access, much like the widget and CarPlay experience. Podcasts can now be pinned to the top of the home-screen list. Pinned podcasts can also be manually reordered with drag-and-drop. I’ve also rethought the old stacked “Podcasts” and “Played Podcasts” sections to better match people’s needs and expectations. Now, the toggle atop the podcast list switches between three modes: podcasts with current episodes, all followed podcasts, and inactive podcasts (those that you don’t follow and therefore won’t get any more episodes from, or haven’t posted a new episode in a long time). The playlist screen’s structure remains mostly the same, while refining the design for the modern era: Playlist screen, before (left) and after (right). Here, it’s more apparent that I’ve replaced the system San Francisco font with an alternate variant, San Francisco Rounded, to increase legibility and better match the personality of the app. I’ve also added highly demanded features: By far, Overcast’s most-requested feature is a Mark as Played feature. That’s now available as a checkmark button on episode rows, as well as a left-side swipe action. The second-most-requested feature is a way to view all starred episodes. Special playlists for Starred, Downloaded, and In Progress can now be created. The light and dark themes now each have a customizable tint color from the modern iOS UI-color palette, including these favorites from beta testers: And throughout the app, I’ve made tons of tweaks and bug fixes, including: Notifications and background downloads are now much more reliable. Episode downloads can now be individually deleted or re-downloaded. Links can now be opened in Safari. (under Nitpicky Details) Performance is now significantly better with very large playlists and collections. Fixed bugs with episode-duration detection, CarPlay lists, Mac-app sharing, and much more. So much is better in this update that I can’t even remember it all. Thank you so much to everyone who helped me beta-test this massive update. As always, Overcast is free in the App Store. Go get it!
